new_state = state
new_state[0].assign(state[0].eval())

I got an error saying --> AttributeError: 'Tensor' object has no attribute 'assign'

Could you please advise how to get the initial state from the LSTM cell when state_tuple=True?

Many thanks : D

body:
@ebrevdo Thank you. But I still can't initialize state from `LSTMStateTuple`.

When `state_is_tuple = False`, I can get new state values by `new_state_val = state.eval()`, and then feed `new_state_val` into `feed_dict`.

However, when `state_is_tuple=True`, I can't initialize the state values as `LSTMStateTuple` does not have `eval()`. So I instead do the following:

```
new_state = state
new_state[0].assign(state[0].eval())
new_state[1].assign(state[1].eval())
```

I got an error saying --> AttributeError: 'Tensor' object has no attribute 'assign'

Could you please advise how to get the initial state from the LSTM cell when `state_tuple=True`?

Many thanks : D
